com.fxgraph.graph

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fxgraph.graph.Graph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CartesianGraph, SequenceDiagram

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates a 2d graph model (graph nodes: cells, edges) and its presentation onto a specialized javafx pane.
    Author:
    sirolf2009, ogallagher (javadoc)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<IGraphNode,javafx.scene.layout.Region> graphics
      Maintains a mapping of graph nodes to their corresponding graphics.
      private Model model
      Managed collection of cells and edges to be shown in the graph.
      private NodeGestures nodeGestures
      Node gestures (cell drag translation).
      private PannableCanvas pannableCanvas
      The canvas on which graph node graphics are displayed (and interactive).
      private javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty useNodeGestures
      Whether to use nodeGestures.
      private javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty useViewportGestures
      Whether to use viewportGestures.
      private ViewportGestures viewportGestures
      Viewport gestures (drag panning, scroll zoom).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Convenience constructor for Graph(new Model()).
      Graph(Model model)
      Graph constructor defines a model to contain cells and edges, default drag-translate node gestures, and default drag-pan and scroll-zoom viewport gestures.

    • Field Detail

      • model

        private final Model model
        Managed collection of cells and edges to be shown in the graph.

      • pannableCanvas

        The canvas on which graph node graphics are displayed (and interactive).

      • graphics

        private final java.util.Map<IGraphNode,javafx.scene.layout.Region> graphics
        Maintains a mapping of graph nodes to their corresponding graphics.

      • nodeGestures

        Node gestures (cell drag translation).

      • viewportGestures

        private final ViewportGestures viewportGestures
        Viewport gestures (drag panning, scroll zoom).

        Whether to use nodeGestures.

        private final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty useViewportGestures
        Whether to use viewportGestures.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Convenience constructor for Graph(new Model()).

      • Graph

        public Graph(Model model)
        Graph constructor defines a model to contain cells and edges, default drag-translate node gestures, and default drag-pan and scroll-zoom viewport gestures. The node and viewport gestures will can enabled and disabled by updating useNodeGestures and useViewportGestures.
        Parameters:
        model - The model which will contain references to included graph nodes (cells, edges).

    • Method Detail

      • getCanvas

        public PannableCanvas getCanvas()
        Returns:
        the graph canvas that acts as the graph's gui pane.

      • getModel

        public Model getModel()
        Returns:
        the model that contains the graph node references.

      • beginUpdate

        public void beginUpdate()
        Clears all widgets from the graph canvas. TODO [ogallagher] this method seems misleading, as an update to the graph shouldn't necessarily mean all current graph nodes be removed.

      • endUpdate

        public void endUpdate()
        Add and remove the appropriate cells and edges as listed in the model to the graph canvas. Then call Model.endUpdate().

      • addEdges

        private void addEdges(java.util.List<IEdge> edges)
        Add edge graphics to the graph canvas.
        Parameters:
        edges - Edges to add.

      • removeEdges

        private void removeEdges(java.util.List<IEdge> edges)
        Remove edge graphics from the graph canvas.
        Parameters:
        edges - Edges to remove.

      • addCells

        private void addCells(java.util.List<ICell> cells)
        Add cell graphics to the graph canvas and enable node gestures.
        Parameters:
        cells - Cells to add.

      • removeCells

        private void removeCells(java.util.List<ICell> cells)
        Remove cell graphics from the graph canvas.
        Parameters:
        cells - Cells to remove.

      • getGraphic

        public javafx.scene.layout.Region getGraphic(IGraphNode node)
        Get the corresponding graphic for the given node (cell, edge).
        Parameters:
        node - The graph node.
        Returns:
        The node's graphic.

      • createGraphic

        public javafx.scene.layout.Region createGraphic(IGraphNode node)
        Create the graphic that will represent the graph node in the canvas.
        Parameters:
        node - The graph node (cell, edge).
        Returns:
        The graphic.

      • getScale

        public double getScale()
        Returns:
        The canvas viewport's scale/zoom value.

      • layout

        public void layout(Layout layout)
        Use the given layout to calculate placement for all contained graph nodes.
        Parameters:
        layout -

      • getNodeGestures
